data.title: Food
data.text: A little fansy for my taste but the food was good. I want to go back and try something else to get a better feel.

data.title: Milano's is such a treat.
data.text: We visited Milano'/ and loved it. Friendly atmosphere. Personal service. Great food. Specialty dishes. We loved it and will return.

data.title: Good Italian Fare
data.text: Wanted to try Milano II which is on my food bucket list. The restaurant is in an old but elegant house that is really beautiful inside. The homemade loaf of bread is delicious with a crispy crust and soft center. The Greek Salad was good but the dressing was too heavy on the vinegar. The Milano's Favorite is quite good. Chicken and italian sausage in a creamy Cajun Alfredo sauce with a soft smokey flavor. The sausage gave the dish a nice spice kick. My server Dani did a great job taking care of me.

data.title: Date night
data.text: 1st time here and we were very impressed. The menu was well rounded with many choices. The staff treated us great the food awesome and the atmosphere romantic

data.title: Good food, service was the issue
data.text:
We went our first time as a couples date night. The waiter was the son of the owner and spent most of his time selling us on the special. Little did we know the "special" was the most expensive item in the menu. He was very flighty as well. We were shocked when we saw the bill. 
The food was good so we decided to give it one more try. Only this time we would experiment with regular menu items. We took my mom for her birthday. Well the son spotted us at the door and told the other waiter "we requested him" not to make a scene as his father was standing at the desk as well, we didn't say anything hoping for a different result. Well no such luck. He tries to sell the whole family on the special and even talked down other menu items. When we all decided to try something different he became very disappointed , verbally said we would be sorry by not choosing the special, and service to the table became spotty. I mentioned it was my mothers birthday and he insisted he would buy her desert. Well it was on the bill in the end. 
We have decided we will never go back at this point.

data.title: Don't miss out!
data.text:
Don't miss out on a perfect meal.  Milanos II is located right off the town square offering top of the line service operating out of an historical home.  The atmosphere combined with great tasting food is what you can expect.

K. Seacrist

data.title: Staycation date with the wife
data.text: It was an invitig and beautiful atmosphere. The server we had was friendly and inviting. We ordered calamari as an appetizer and it was prepared well. Tender and the marinara appeared homemade and if not, tasted so. I ordered eggplant parmesan and it was some of the best I've had eating out in a restaurant. The salad that came with had a surprisingly good creamy Italian. They also serve bread with olive oil and pepper. Not a fan of dessert trays with stale replicas of what is served however they do bring a desert tray around and we ordered tiramisu. They stated it was homemade and I found it to be delicious. Over all, the experience was friendly, inviting, and recommended. Will definitely keep in mind to bring visiting family here for Italian or for more formal events.

data.title: Upscale Italian
data.text:
Milanos II was a delightful discovery.  It's in a home remodeled into a restaurant, so lots of unique rooms to enjoy.  The food is tasty and the setting is relaxing [with Italian music].
The only drawback is that they do not serve wine.  They do have beer, but an Italian restaurant with a good red wine is a disappointment.

data.title: Love Milanos II
data.text: I've had a few meals there and the food is always top quality.  The owner and the servers are very friendly and helpful.

data.title: I SUGGEST...
data.text: We ordered the special..which was salmon with the "special" creamy marsala sauce, topped with shrimp.  We also had the Greek salad to start.  Bread and olive oil was served to start.  Ok.  This restaurant has so much potential.  Please do not use old bread and disguise it by toasting it...it is way too obvious, if you want to be a "great" restaurant.  By the way..the olive oil was very fresh and flavorful, I only wish we had some decent bread to go along with it.  AND...this was the first impression...not the best.  The Greek salad was good...but please, can you splurge on more than two olives? I mean, really, olives are a BIG difference between a "salad" and a "Greek salad".  It is very obvious that you "count" your olives.  Throw five or six olives, a peppereronci and more Feta cheese on a Greek salad!  This left another "bad taste" in our mouth.  Then the entree was served.  It was really tasty!  Very good salmon...not overcooked.  The shrimp were very good as well.  And it is correct..the Marsala sauce is great.  I would return to this restaurant, but my advice to the chef is: don't set people up with "so so" before you serve your specialty because by then, they have already formed some of their opinion.  Hopefully, Milano's II will stop cutting important (small) corners that truly leave a lasting impression.

data.title: "Trust me", No Thank you
data.text: We had seen the place and have been meaning to go.  The wife loves Italian food and I like making my wife happy so away we went.  We had no sooner hit the door and the waiters (who later mentioned, was the owners son) every other word was "Trust me"  Its the greatest restaurant in all Murfreesboro, trust me.  He did his duty in telling us the specials but the proceeded to recommend all the highest priced items on the menu.  I tried no to blame him for upselling but he was wearing us OUT!  When I commented on the lower priced Chiefs recommend dish, he said "its good but you don't want that"  The wife ended up ordering chicken flicatcha (spelling? sorry)  The waiter said, NO you need to get the veal.  My wife said no and he then started to tell her why she was wrong, wow!   I was ready to leave, wife said lets at least try the food.  The dishes came out...Veal???  I said we ordered the chicken,  He said "trust me you didn't"  Order sorted out and we begin to eat.  Not much to mention, I would even say Olive Garden is better.  I'll cut the rude behavior short and mention that as we were pulling into the drive the Mrs mentions not feeling all that well and heads to the bathroom.  She has a fairly light stomach and we blamed it on the cream in the salad dressing.  Me on the other hand have a well seasoned cast iron stomach, about an hour later it was now my turn to head for the bathroom.  We will never return.  Good luck to all of you who try this place, I hope your time there is better than ours.  Salad and bread were good, oh and the coke, lol

data.title: Amazing food!!
data.text: This is the first time we returned to Milanos II since they reopened and we are sorry it took us so long.  The food and service were amazing.  Kareem (hope I spelled that right) was so attentive and made great recommendations for the daily special (Mahi Mahi) and a menu selection (Angel Hair Pomodoro Con Pesto with Shrimp).  AMAZING!!

data.title: Nice but room for some improvement.
data.text:
Overall our party of 18 all enjoyed the food.  I ordered the New York Strip and it was good well, but had more fat than i am use to in this cut of meat.  I also asked 3 times for steak sauce but never was delivered.  The waiters need to keep track of who ordered what better.  In this type of restaurant they should not have to ask who ordered what.  The deserts were very good.  I had never had a banana cheescake before.  It was good.  

Overall a good place but need to improve a few items to be great.

Try it out!

data.title: Good food, atmosphere and fair prices
data.text: Fresh, hot, authentic recipes & delightful presentation.  The quaint location is a big plus for setting the mood for date night or family gathering.  Yummy

data.title: Quaint, friendly, & tasty Italian!
data.text: Stopped in on a recommendation and so glad we did. The staff was very attentive but not annoyingly so. The menu was just the right size and everything we were served was very good. The room we were seated in was very cozy with a fireplace. We thought it was great.

data.title: Need some TLC
data.text: Waited a while before being seated, decor needs much needed update, paint, tables and chairs, flooring.  Food was good, staff nice.

data.title: Awesome!!
data.text: We have company dinners there and it is nothing short of amazing...food and service!  Highly recommend!!

data.title: Good menu
data.text:
We went with a group of about 20 for dinner. Servers were attentive but our waitress either couldn't handle variations to the menu (like red sauce vs Alfredo) or the kitchen didn't do it right. Ether way she should have checked before serving the entree. So some dishes went back others accepted what was served. 
Restaurant does not have a full liquor license so you may bring your own wine and they do serve beer.  
Food was good, salads were OK but what Italian rest

data.title: Birthday celebration for Diane
data.text: Best service and care! Had our own private area, food was superb and atmosphere was perfect! Jack surprised us with entertainment! So glad Milano's II is back in the Boro!

data.title: Lovely restaurant
data.text: Just happened upon this restaurant in downtown Murfreesboro for Sunday Lunch.  The food, staff, atmosphere, price and overall experience was great.  I had Shrimp on a Skewer with veggies and it was very delicious.  The price $7.00  (I think) and the portion was just right for lunch.  No complaints at all and I would certainly go back when I'm in that area.  Highly recommend this establishment.
